intro: Dortmanna brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Dortmanna, is a small perennial plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like foliage and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. Native to the temperate regions of Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a fibrous root system and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, with a unique appearance that aids in its identification.
